secret_rule: The item can be brought to the picnic only if its name is a single-word noun that starts with the letter 'Q'.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "Quilt" and "Quiver".

Given the two example items "Quilt" and "Quiver", I notice they both start with the letter "Q". So my next strategic guess would be:

"Can I bring a Quarter?"

This fits the pattern of starting with "Q" and will help me test whether the rule relates to the first letter of the item.
Yes, you can bring a Quarter.

After confirming that "Quarter" is also allowed, I want to test whether the rule might indeed be about the first letter "Q". I'll strategically choose another item that starts with "Q" but is quite different from the previous examples:

"Can I bring a Quill?"

This guess is different from previous items (Quilt, Quiver, Quarter) but still starts with "Q", which helps me systematically test the letter-based hypothesis.
Yes, you can bring a Quill.

Given the examples of "Quilt", "Quiver", "Quarter", and "Quill", and the consistent success of items starting with "Q", I am very confident that the secret rule is:

The item must start with the letter "Q".

This rule is strongly supported by:
1. All successful items (Quilt, Quiver, Quarter, Quill) begin with "Q"
2. There's a clear pattern across multiple different types of items
3. The items are diverse (fabric, weapon, coin, writing tool) but share the "Q" initial letter
4. No counter-examples have been provided to challenge this hypothesis

My guess is that the rule is definitively: "Items must start with the letter Q".
